SENT.plain: We report a newborn male who presented with severe central cyanosis on the third day of life
Partial thrombotic obstruction of the pulmonary trunk secondary to Antithrombin III (homozygous defect of heparin binding site) deficiency was subsequently diagnosed
Surgical thrombectomy, and infusions of Antithrombin III concentrate, led to a successful outcome
We postulate that intrauterine thrombosis occurred to give this unusual presentation
